intro: Townsendia ambigua, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Townsendia ambigua is often found in rocky habitats and is known for its drought tolerance.
